description: Contact details for Student Finance England - including complaints and student finance appeals, Advanced Learner Loan.

details.body:
Contact Student Finance England if you need help with things like:

  • checking the progress of your application
  • resetting your login details
  • updating your personal or course details
  • making a complaint or an appeal

Contact the Student Loans Company if you need help with your student loan repayment.

If you want to speak to an adviser about your child’s or partner’s student finance application, you’ll need to get their consent before calling Student Finance England.

options.label: Supporting your child's or partner's student finance application

nodes.body: If you’re not studying yet, select the course you’re applying for.

nodes.title: What is your question about?

nodes.body:
Read the guidance on how to check the progress of your student finance application before you contact Student Finance England.

Online

Sign in to your online account to:

  • check what stage your application is at – they take 6 to 8 weeks to process
  • check how much and when you’ll be paid
  • change your personal or course details
  • reset your password

Webchat

You can chat to an adviser in your online account.

Monday to Friday, 9am to 5:30pm

You will only see the webchat option if there is an adviser available.

Other ways to get help

Telephone

Telephone: 0300 100 0607
Text relay (if you cannot hear or speak on the phone): 18001 then 0300 100 0607
Monday to Friday, 8am to 8pm
Saturday, 9am to 4pm
Find out about call charges

If you have a customer reference number, have it with you when you call.

Address

Student Finance England
PO Box 210
Darlington DL1 9HJ

Social media

Twitter: @SF_England
Facebook: @SFEngland

You can only get help with general queries on social media. Do not give any personal details.

nodes.title: If you’re from the EU and you're applying for tuition fee funding

nodes.body:
Read the guidance on funding for postgraduate study before you contact Student Finance England.

Online

Sign in to your online account to:

  • check what stage your application is at – they take 6 to 8 weeks to process
  • check how much and when you’ll be paid
  • change your personal or course details
  • reset your password

Other ways to get help

Telephone

Telephone: 0300 100 0031
Text relay (if you cannot hear or speak on the phone): 18001 then 0300 100 0031
Monday to Friday, 8am to 8pm
Saturday, 9am to 4pm
Find out about call charges

If you have a customer reference number, have it with you when you call.

Address

Student Finance England
PO Box 210
Darlington DL1 9HJ

Social media

Twitter: @SF_England
Facebook: @SFEngland

You can only get help with general queries on social media. Do not give any personal details.

Complaints

Contact the Student Loans Company if you want to make a complaint.

Appeals

An appeal is a formal request to Student Finance England asking them to review a decision about whether you can get financial help and if so how much.

Read the guidance and complete the appeals form.
nodes.title: Get help with a Postgraduate Loan

nodes.body:
Sign in to your student loan repayment account if you already have one.

To sign in you’ll need your:

  • customer reference number or email address
  • password
  • secret answer, for example your mother’s maiden name

If you do not know these, you can reset them using the email address you had when you applied for your loan.

Contact the Student Loans Company if:

  • you’ve changed your email address
  • you want someone else to deal with your account on your behalf
  • you have a question that you cannot answer in your online account

You can also read the guidance on repaying your student loan.

Appeals

Read the guidance and complete the appeals form.

nodes.title: Resetting your login details

nodes.body:
Read the guidance on student finance before you contact Student Finance England.

You cannot speak to Student Finance England about your child’s or partner’s account unless they have given consent. They can give consent to share this information when they apply or at a later date.

Online

Sign in to your online account to:

  • check what stage your application is at – they take 6 to 8 weeks to process
  • check how much and when you’ll be paid
  • change your personal or course details
  • reset your password

Webchat

You can chat to an adviser in your online account.

Monday to Friday, 9am to 5:30pm

You will only see the webchat option if there is an adviser available.

Other ways to get help

Darlington DL1 9HJ

Social media

nodes.title: If you have a question about something else

nodes.body:
Read about getting your first student finance payment before you contact Student Finance England.

Online

Sign into your online account to check:

  • your payment schedule
  • the amount you’ll get

You can also view and update your bank details.

Webchat

You can chat to an adviser in your online account.

Monday to Friday, 9am to 5:30pm

You will only see the webchat option if there is an adviser available.

nodes.title: Checking how much and when you'll get paid

nodes.title: If you’re from the EU and you're applying for tuition fee funding and help with living costs

nodes.body:
Read the guidance on how to support your child’s or partner’s student finance application if your question is about:

  • giving details of your income
  • if your income has gone down
  • if you need to update your personal details

If you need information about the progress of your child or partner’s application, ask them to check their online account. Student Finance England will only contact you if they need to ask for additional evidence.

Online

Sign in to your online account to:

  • upload evidence to support an application, including your household income
  • reset your login details
  • check your application is complete

Webchat

You can chat to an adviser in your online account.

Monday to Friday, 9am to 5:30pm

You will only see the webchat option if there is an adviser available.

Other ways to get help

Telephone

Telephone: 0300 100 0607
Text relay (if you cannot hear or speak on the phone): 18001 then 0300 100 0607
Monday to Friday, 8am to 8pm
Saturday, 9am to 4pm
Find out about call charges

If you have a customer reference number, have it with you when you call.

Address

Student Finance England
PO Box 210
Darlington DL1 9HJ

Social media

Twitter: @SF_England
Facebook: @SFEngland

You can only get help with general queries on social media. Do not give any personal details.
nodes.title: If your question is about something else

nodes.body:
If you’ve had student finance or supported an application before, you probably have a student finance account already. You’ll need to sign in to your account to reactivate it. You’ll be able to reset your login details if you’ve forgotten them.

Other ways to get help

Telephone

Telephone: 0300 100 0607
Text relay (if you cannot hear or speak on the phone): 18001 then 0300 100 0607
Monday to Friday, 8am to 8pm
Saturday, 9am to 4pm
Find out about call charges

If you have a customer reference number, have it with you when you call.

Address

Student Finance England
PO Box 210
Darlington DL1 9HJ

Social media

Twitter: @SF_England
Facebook: @SFEngland

You can only get help with general queries on social media. Do not give any personal details.
nodes.title: If you’re having problems setting up your online account

nodes.body:
Read the guidance on how to give details about your household income before contacting Student Finance England.

Online

Sign in to your online account to give your household income details.

You’ll need information about your income from a previous tax year - which year depends on when your child or partner applied.

You’ll need to tell Student Finance England about:

  • your personal taxable income
  • any income your child gets from their own savings, investments or property - if you’re supporting your child’s application

If you’ve had student finance or supported an application before, you’ll need to sign in to your student finance account. You can reset your login details if you’ve forgotten them.

Webchat

You can chat to an adviser in your online account.

Monday to Friday, 9am to 5:30pm

You will only see the webchat option if there is an adviser available.

Other ways to get help

Telephone

Telephone: 0300 100 0607
Text relay (if you cannot hear or speak on the phone): 18001 then 0300 100 0607
Monday to Friday, 8am to 8pm
Saturday, 9am to 4pm
Find out about call charges

If you have a customer reference number, have it with you when you call.

Address

Student Finance England
PO Box 210
Darlington DL1 9HJ

Social media

Twitter: @SF_England
Facebook: @SFEngland

You can only get help with general queries on social media. Do not give any personal details.
nodes.title: If you need to tell Student Finance England about your income

nodes.body:
Read the guidance on what to do if your income has gone down before contacting Student Finance England.

You’ll need to fill in a current year income assessment form and send it to Student Finance England. You can send it through your online account or send it by post.

Student Finance England
PO Box 210
Darlington DL1 9HJ

Webchat

You can chat to an adviser in your online account.

Monday to Friday, 9am to 5:30pm

You will only see the webchat option if there is an adviser available.

Other ways to get help

Telephone

Telephone: 0300 100 0607
Text relay (if you cannot hear or speak on the phone): 18001 then 0300 100 0607
Monday to Friday, 8am to 8pm
Saturday, 9am to 4pm
Find out about call charges

If you have a customer reference number, have it with you when you call.

Social media

Twitter: @SF_England
Facebook: @SFEngland

You can only get help with general queries on social media. Do not give any personal details.
nodes.title: If your income has gone down

nodes.body:
Read the guidance on how to update your details if your circumstances change before contacting Student Finance England.

Online

Sign into your online account to update your marital status.

Webchat

Monday to Friday, 9am to 5:30pm

You will only see the webchat option if there is an adviser available.

Other ways to get help

Telephone

Text relay (if you cannot hear or speak on the phone): 18001 then 0300 100 0607
Monday to Friday, 8am to 8pm
Saturday, 9am to 4pm
Find out about call charges

If you have a customer reference number, have it with you when you call.

Address

Student Finance England \\
PO Box 210 \\
Darlington DL1 9HJ

Social media

Facebook: @SFEngland

You can only get help with general queries on social media. Do not give any personal details.
